snippet: President Mohamed Morsi ousted his powerful defense minister, the army chief of staff and several senior generals, seeming for the moment to reclaim power the military had seized.
abstract: President Mohamed Morsi of Egypt forces the retirement of his powerful defense minister, the army chief of staff and other senior generals, moving more aggressively than ever before to reclaim political power that the military had seized since the fall of Hosni Mubarak last year; also nullifies a constitutional declaration, issued by the military before Morsi took office on June 30, that had gutted the authority of his office and replaces it with his own declaration, giving him broad legislative and executive powers.

byline.contributor: Steven Lee Myers contributed reporting from Washington, David D. Kirkpatrick from New York, and Mayy El Sheikh from Cairo.

lead_paragraph: President Mohamed Morsi ousted his powerful defense minister, the army chief of staff and several senior generals, seeming for the moment to reclaim power the military had seized.

headline.main: In Upheaval for Egypt, Morsi Forces Out Military Chiefs
headline.print_headline: Egyptian Leader Pushes Generals Into Retirement
